intro: Begonia euryphylla, commonly known as the broad-leaved begonia, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter. The plant produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil. Begonia euryphylla is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its striking foliage and delicate blooms.
